Structs/AnimationFrame.html#/s:6Motion14.name: targetTimestamp
Structs/AnimationFrame.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: The timestamp that represents when the next frame displays.

Structs/AnimationFrame.html#/s:6Motion14.name: duration
Structs/AnimationFrame.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: The current duration between last frame and target frame.

Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: response
Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: The response time of the spring (in seconds). This is used to change how long (approximately) it will take for the spring to reach its destination.

Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: dampingRatio
Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: The damping ratio of the spring ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. This describes how much the spring should oscillate around its destination point.

Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: w0
Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: The undamped angular frequency of the spring.

Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: wD
Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: A cached constant representing the decaying amount of the harmonic frequency derived from w0 * sqrt(1.0 - dampingRatio^2).

Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: configure(response:dampingRatio:)
Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Convenience function to configure the stiffness and damping based on easier to work with constants.

Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: configure(stiffness:damping:)
Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Convenience function to configure the stiffness and damping all at once.

Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: solveSIMD(dt:x0:velocity:)
Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Solves the spring function based on the given parameters for a SupportedSIMD type.

Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: solve(dt:x0:velocity:)
Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Solves the spring function for a given Value.

Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: solve(dt:x0:velocity:)
Structs/SpringFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Solves the spring function for a given Value when Value conforms to SupportedSIMD.

Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV2x.name: x1
Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV2x.abstract: The x value of the first point.

Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV2x.name: x2
Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV2x.abstract: The y value of the first point.

Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV2y.name: y1
Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV2y.abstract: The x value of the second point.

Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV2y.name: y2
Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV2y.abstract: The y value of the second point.

Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV2x.name: init(x1:y1:x2:y2:)
Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV2x.abstract: Initializes the bezier curve with two points.

Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV9s.name: solveForT(x:epsilon:)
Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV9s.abstract: Solves for the t value given an x value for the function x(t).

Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV9s.name: solveForT(y:epsilon:)
Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV9s.abstract: Solves for the t value given a y value for the function y(t).

Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV5s.name: solve(x:epsilon:)
Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV5s.abstract: Solves for the y value of the bezier curve for a given x value and an optional epsilon.

Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV5s.name: solve(y:epsilon:)
Structs/Bezier.html#/s:6Motion6BezierV5s.abstract: Solves for the x value for the bezier curve for a given y value and an optional epsilon.

Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: linear
Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: An easing function with a linear bezier curve.

Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: easeIn
Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: An easing function with an ease-in bezier curve that matches UIKit’s kCAMediaTimingFunctionEaseIn.

Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: easeOut
Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: An easing function with an ease-out bezier curve that matcheskCAMediaTimingFunctionEaseOut.

Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: easeInOut
Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: An easing function with an ease-out bezier curve that matcheskCAMediaTimingFunctionEaseInOut.

Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: init(bezier:)
Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Initializes the easing function with a given Bezier.

Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: solveInterpolatedValueSIMD(_:fraction:)
Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Solves for a SIMD value within a given range based on the easing function.

Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: solveInterpolatedValue(_:fraction:)
Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Solves for a Value within a given range based on the easing function.

Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: hash(into:)
Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Hashes this easing curve into a hash.

Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.name: solveInterpolatedValue(_:fraction:)
Structs/EasingFunction.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Solves for a Value within a given range based on the easing function when the Value type conforms to SupportedSIMD.

Structs/DecayFunction.html#/s:6Motion13D.name: decayConstant
Structs/DecayFunction.html#/s:6Motion13D.abstract: The rate at which the velocity decays over time. Defaults to UIKitDecayConstant.

Structs/DecayFunction.html#/s:6Motion13D.name: solveSIMD(dt:x0:velocity:)
Structs/DecayFunction.html#/s:6Motion13D.abstract: Solves the decay function based on the given parameters for a SupportedSIMD type.

Structs/DecayFunction.html#/s:6Motion13D.name: solve(dt:x0:velocity:)
Structs/DecayFunction.html#/s:6Motion13D.abstract: Solves the decay function for a given Value.

Structs/DecayFunction.html#/s:6Motion13D.name: solve(dt:x0:velocity:)
Structs/DecayFunction.html#/s:6Motion13D.abstract: Solves the decay function for a given Value when Value conforms to SupportedSIMD.

Structs/DecayFunction.html.name: DecayFunction
Structs/DecayFunction.html.abstract: This class provides an interface to use various optimized implementations of a decay function with SupportedSIMD and Value types.

Structs/EasingFunction.html.name: EasingFunction
Structs/EasingFunction.html.abstract: An easing function powered by a Bezier that can be used with a BasicAnimation.

Structs/Bezier.html.name: Bezier
Structs/Bezier.html.abstract: A Swift adaptation of UnitBezier from WebKit: https://opensource.apple.com/source/WebCore/WebCore-955.66/platform/graphics/UnitBezier.h

Structs/SpringFunction.html.name: SpringFunction
Structs/SpringFunction.html.abstract: This class provides an interface to use various optimized implementations of the analytic versions of spring functions with SupportedSIMD and Value types.

Protocols/CAKeyframeAnimationEmittable.h.name: keyframeAnimation(forFramerate:)
Protocols/CAKeyframeAnimationEmittable.h.abstract: Generates and returns a CAKeyframeAnimation based on the animation’s current state targeting the animation’s resolved state..

Protocols/CAKeyframeAnimationEmittable.h.name: populateKeyframeAnimationData(dt:values:keyTimes:)
Protocols/CAKeyframeAnimationEmittable.h.abstract: Generates and returns the values and keyTimes for a CAKeyframeAnimation. This is called by default from keyframeAnimation(forFramerate:).

Protocols/SIMDRepresentable.html#/s:6Mot.name: SIMDType
Protocols/SIMDRepresentable.html#/s:6Mot.abstract: The SIMD type that self can be represented by.

Protocols/EquatableEnough.html#/s:6Motio.name: approximatelyEqual(to:epsilon:)
Protocols/EquatableEnough.html#/s:6Motio.abstract: Declares whether or not something else is equal to self within a given tolerance.

Protocols/EquatableEnough.html#/s:6Motio.name: epsilon
Protocols/EquatableEnough.html#/s:6Motio.abstract: The epsilon used for the tolerance range in EquatableEnough. Defaults to 0.001.

Protocols/EquatableEnough.html#/s:6Motio.name: epsilon
Protocols/EquatableEnough.html#/s:6Motio.abstract: The epsilon used for the tolerance range in EquatableEnough. Defaults to 0.001.

Protocols/EquatableEnough.html#/s:6Motio.name: epsilon
Protocols/EquatableEnough.html#/s:6Motio.abstract: The epsilon used for the tolerance range in EquatableEnough. Defaults to Self(0.001).

Protocols/FloatingPointInitializable.htm.name: FloatingPointInitializable
Protocols/FloatingPointInitializable.htm.abstract: A protocol that describes something that can be initialized by a floating point value.

Protocols/EquatableEnough.html.name: EquatableEnough
Protocols/EquatableEnough.html.abstract: A protocol that describes something that is approximately equal to something else within a given tolerance (e.g. a floating point value that is equal to another floating point value within a given epsilon).

Protocols.html#/s:6Motion13SupportedSIMD.name: SupportedSIMD
Protocols.html#/s:6Motion13SupportedSIMD.abstract: A protocol that defines supported SIMD types that conform to SIMDRepresentable and EquatableEnough.

Protocols/SupportedScalar.html.name: SupportedScalar
Protocols/SupportedScalar.html.abstract: A protocol that defines supported SIMD Scalar types that conform to FloatingPointInitializable, EquatableEnough, and are RealModule.Real numbers.

Protocols/SIMDRepresentable.html.name: SIMDRepresentable
Protocols/SIMDRepresentable.html.abstract: A protocol that defines how something that can be represented / stored in a SIMD type as well as instantiated from said SIMD type.

Protocols/CAKeyframeAnimationEmittable.h.name: CAKeyframeAnimationEmittable
Protocols/CAKeyframeAnimationEmittable.h.abstract: A protocol that defines the ability to generate a CAKeyframeAnimation from an Animation.

Protocols/CAKeyframeAnimationValueConver.name: CAKeyframeAnimationValueConvertible
Protocols/CAKeyframeAnimationValueConver.abstract: A protocol for types to supply the ability to convert themselves into NSValue or NSNumber for use with CAKeyframeAnimation. This is required for CAKeyframeAnimationEmittable.

Functions.html#/s:6Motion4mabsyxxAA13Sup.name: mabs(_:)
Functions.html#/s:6Motion4mabsyxxAA13Sup.abstract: Exposes a variant of abs that supports all SIMD types.

Functions.html#/s:6Motion16CADisableActi.name: CADisableActions(_:)
Functions.html#/s:6Motion16CADisableActi.abstract: Helper method to disable all implicitly created animations inside the supplied block.

Functions.html#/s:6Motion10rubberband_11.name: rubberband(_:coefficient:boundsSize:contentSize:)
Functions.html#/s:6Motion10rubberband_11.abstract: Rubberbands a floating point value based on a given coefficient and range.

Extensions/CALayer.html#/s:So7CALayerC6M.name: add(_:forKey:keyPath:)
Extensions/CALayer.html#/s:So7CALayerC6M.abstract: Adds a supported animation conforming to CAKeyframeAnimationEmittable to a given CALayer.

Extensions/SIMD64.html#/s:s6SIMD64V6Moti.name: approximatelyEqual(to:epsilon:)
Extensions/SIMD64.html#/s:s6SIMD64V6Moti.abstract: Declares whether or not another SIMD64 is equal to self within a given tolerance (epsilon).
Returns whether or not all values of lhs (individually, sequentially) are less than all values of rhs (following the same ordering as lhs).

Extensions/SIMD32.html#/s:s6SIMD32V6Moti.name: approximatelyEqual(to:epsilon:)
Extensions/SIMD32.html#/s:s6SIMD32V6Moti.abstract: Declares whether or not another SIMD32 is equal to self within a given tolerance (epsilon).
Returns whether or not all values of lhs (individually, sequentially) are less than all values of rhs (following the same ordering as lhs).

Extensions/SIMD16.html#/s:s6SIMD16V6Moti.name: approximatelyEqual(to:epsilon:)
Extensions/SIMD16.html#/s:s6SIMD16V6Moti.abstract: Declares whether or not another SIMD16 is equal to self within a given tolerance (epsilon).
Returns whether or not all values of lhs (individually, sequentially) are less than all values of rhs (following the same ordering as lhs).

Extensions/SIMD8.html#/s:s5SIMD8V6Motion.name: approximatelyEqual(to:epsilon:)
Extensions/SIMD8.html#/s:s5SIMD8V6Motion.abstract: Declares whether or not another SIMD8 is equal to self within a given tolerance (epsilon).
Returns whether or not all values of lhs (individually, sequentially) are less than all values of rhs (following the same ordering as lhs).

Extensions/SIMD4.html#/s:s5SIMD4V6Motion.name: approximatelyEqual(to:epsilon:)
Extensions/SIMD4.html#/s:s5SIMD4V6Motion.abstract: Declares whether or not another SIMD4 is equal to self within a given tolerance (epsilon).
Returns whether or not all values of lhs (individually, sequentially) are less than all values of rhs (following the same ordering as lhs).

Extensions/SIMD3.html#/s:s5SIMD3V6Motion.name: approximatelyEqual(to:epsilon:)
Extensions/SIMD3.html#/s:s5SIMD3V6Motion.abstract: Declares whether or not another SIMD3 is equal to self within a given tolerance (epsilon).
Returns whether or not all values of lhs (individually, sequentially) are less than all values of rhs (following the same ordering as lhs).

Extensions/SIMD2.html#/s:s5SIMD2V6Motion.name: approximatelyEqual(to:epsilon:)
Extensions/SIMD2.html#/s:s5SIMD2V6Motion.abstract: Declares whether or not another SIMD2 is equal to self within a given tolerance (epsilon).
Returns whether or not all values of lhs (individually, sequentially) are less than all values of rhs (following the same ordering as lhs).

Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: ValueChangedCallback
Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: A block to be called when value changes.

Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: updateValue(to:postValueChanged:)
Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Updates value to the supplied value and optionally invokes onValueChanged.

Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: velocity
Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: The velocity of the animation. Setting this before calling start will cause the animation to be seeded with that velocity, and then the velocity may change over time.

Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: supportsVelocity
Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Returns whether or not this class supports velocity.

Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: resolvingEpsilon
Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: The default tolerance level for an animation to be considered finished.

Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: onValueChanged(disableActions:_:)
Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Call this to register a ValueChangedCallback block that will be called anytime value changes from tick or if explicitly specified via postValueChanged.

Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: stop(resolveImmediately:postValueChanged:)
Classes/ValueAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Stops the animation immediately and preserves the last set value. This is unlike CoreAnimation where the model and presentation layers get get mismatched.

Classes/Animation.html#/s:6Motion9Animat.name: enabled
Classes/Animation.html#/s:6Motion9Animat.abstract: Whether or not this animation is running.

Classes/Animation.html#/s:6Motion9Animat.name: completion
Classes/Animation.html#/s:6Motion9Animat.abstract: A completion block to be called when the animation completes successfully.

Classes/Animation.html#/s:6Motion9Animat.name: init()
Classes/Animation.html#/s:6Motion9Animat.abstract: Default initializer. Animations must be strongly held to continue to animate.

Classes/Animation.html#/s:6Motion9Animat.name: hasResolved()
Classes/Animation.html#/s:6Motion9Animat.abstract: Determines whether or not the animation should be considered resolved, or at rest.

Classes/Animation.html#/s:6Motion9Animat.name: tick(frame:)
Classes/Animation.html#/s:6Motion9Animat.abstract: Called by AnimationDriverObserver to advance the animation by the specified time interval dt (correlating with the framerate of the display).

Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.name: velocity
Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.abstract: The velocity of the animation. Setting this before calling start will cause the spring animation to be seeded with that velocity, and then the velocity will decay over time.

Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.name: response
Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.abstract: The response time of the spring (in seconds). This is used to change how long (approximately) it will take for the spring to reach its destination.

Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.name: dampingRatio
Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.abstract: The damping ratio of the spring ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. This describes how much the spring should oscillate around its destination point.

Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.name: clampingRange
Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.abstract: An optional range to clamp value to be within the specified upper and lower bound.

Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.name: resolvesUponReachingToValue
Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.abstract: When true, the animation will complete once value reaches toValue (regardless of velocity, overshoot, or rebounding). Defaults to false.

Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.name: init(initialValue:)
Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.abstract: Initializes a SpringAnimation with an optional initial value.

Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.name: init(initialValue:stiffness:damping:)
Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.abstract: A convenience initializer to create a SpringAnimation with stiffness and damping constants.

Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.name: init(initialValue:response:dampingRatio:)
Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.abstract: A convenience initializer to create a SpringAnimation with a given response and dampingRatio.

Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.name: configure(stiffness:damping:)
Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.abstract: Convenience function to configure the stiffness and damping all at once.

Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.name: configure(response:dampingRatio:)
Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.abstract: Convenience function to configure the stiffness and damping based on easier to work with constants.

Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.name: hasResolved()
Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.abstract: Returns whether or not the spring animation has resolved. It is considered resolved when the toValue is reached, and velocity is zero.

Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.name: stop(resolveImmediately:postValueChanged:)
Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.abstract: Stops the animation and optionally resolves it immediately (jumping to the toValue).

Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.name: populateKeyframeAnimationData(dt:values:keyTimes:)
Classes/SpringAnimation.html#/s:6Motion1.abstract: Generates and populates the values and keyTimes for a given SpringAnimation animating from its value to its toValue by ticking it by dt until it resolves.

Classes/DecayAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: hasResolved()
Classes/DecayAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Returns whether or not the animation has resolved. It is considered resolved when its velocity reaches zero.

Classes/DecayAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: init(initialValue:decayConstant:)
Classes/DecayAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Initializes a DecayAnimation with an initial value and decay constant.

Classes/DecayAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: stop(resolveImmediately:postValueChanged:)
Classes/DecayAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Stops the animation and optionally resolves it immediately.

Classes/DecayAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: populateKeyframeAnimationData(dt:values:keyTimes:)
Classes/DecayAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Generates and populates the values and keyTimes for a given DecayAnimation animating from its value and ticking by dt until it resolves.

Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: fromValue
Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: The starting point of the animation. Defaults to .zero.

Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: duration
Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: How long, in seconds, the animation should take.

Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: easingFunction
Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: The easing function the animation should use. For example: .easeIn starts out slow, and then speeds up, whereas .linear is constant speed.

Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: stop(resolveImmediately:postValueChanged:)
Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Stops the animation and optionally resolves it immediately (jumping to the toValue).

Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: reset(postValueChanged:)
Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Stops and resets the animation back to its fromValue position and resets the elapsed time to zero.

Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: hasResolved()
Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Returns whether or not this animation has resolved.

Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.name: populateKeyframeAnimationData(dt:values:keyTimes:)
Classes/BasicAnimation.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Generates and populates the values and keyTimes for a given BasicAnimation animating from its value to its toValue by ticking it by dt until it resolves.

Classes/AnimationGroup.html#/s:6Motion14.name: hasResolved()
Classes/AnimationGroup.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Returns whether or not all of the animations have resolved.

Classes/AnimationGroup.html#/s:6Motion14.name: start()
Classes/AnimationGroup.html#/s:6Motion14.abstract: Starts the animation group. Animating each animation in the group sequentially each frame.

Classes/AnimationGroup.html.name: AnimationGroup
Classes/AnimationGroup.html.abstract: This class allows for grouping and running animations in parallel.

Classes/BasicAnimation.html.name: BasicAnimation
Classes/BasicAnimation.html.abstract: This class provides the ability to animate types that conform to Value based on basic curves (i.e. EasingFunction.easeIn, EasingFunction.easeInOut, etc.).

Classes/DecayAnimation.html.name: DecayAnimation
Classes/DecayAnimation.html.abstract: This class provides the ability to animate types that conform to Value based on decay functions.

Classes/SpringAnimation.html.name: SpringAnimation
Classes/SpringAnimation.html.abstract: This class provides the ability to animate Value using a physically-modeled spring.

Classes/Animation.html.name: Animation
Classes/Animation.html.abstract: This class acts as the base class for all animations within Motion. It doesn’t do much, other than serve as a base class for all animations to inherit from and implement.

Classes/ValueAnimation.html.name: ValueAnimation
Classes/ValueAnimation.html.abstract: This class provides the ability to animate changes to values (Value) over time.

Global%20Variables.html.name: Global Variables
Global%20Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.
